newsitem.title: USA: Netscape says to have record output in Q2.
newsitem.headline: Netscape says to have record output in Q2.

text.p: Netscape Communications Corp will ship more new products in the second quarter than in any other quarter in its history, Marc Andreessen, the company's chief technology officer, said Monday.

Netscape, the Internet software company, will ship its new Communicator program and a new version of its SuiteSpot package of networking software within a few weeks, Andreesen told investors at the Hambrecht & Quist Technology Conference.
"The second quarter will be our biggest product roll-out," he said. The company also has a slew of new products ready for introduction in the third and fourth quarter.

The major new product will be Communicator, a program that melds an Internet browser, e-mailing programs and scheduling software. It also will begin selling SuiteSpot 3.0, a new software that controls information flow in corporate networks.
Andreessen added Netscape plans to continue to "invest heavily" in its consulting practice, a unit that helps big companies base networks on Netscape's intranet software.

Netscape also will concentrate on software that helps companies communicate and do business with customers through the Internet or private networks. The company expects this so-called "extranet" market to be "enormous," he added.
